body.text: College of Engineering and Computer Science
Department of Industrial Engineering and Management Systems

courseSection0.text:
College of Engineering & Computer Science
Dr. Timothy Kotnour
407-823-5645
Timothy.Kotnour@ucf.edu

p.Provides a knowledge base in technical l: Provides a knowledge base in technical leadership and management principles and practices in a technical environment. This certificate is designed to enhance the student's marketability, preparation and career viability as they enter the engineering and computer science professions.

li.Students must have a declared Computer S: Students must have a declared Computer Science or engineering major. Not open to students in engineering pending majors.

courseSection0.text:
Provides a knowledge base in technical leadership and management principles and practices in a technical environment. This certificate is designed to enhance the student's marketability, preparation and career viability as they enter the engineering and computer science professions.
Admission Requirements
Students must have a declared Computer Science or engineering major. Not open to students in engineering pending majors.
Certificate Requirements
None
Prerequisite Courses
None

courseSection0.text0: Discipline specific design course in engineering or
courseSection0.text1:
Complete the following: 
CAP4102 - Web and User Experience (UX) (3)
courseSection0.text2:
Complete the following: 
EGS3031 - Leadership in Engineering II 
EGS3031 - Leadership in Engineering II 
EGS4950 - Engineering Leadership Capstone (3)
courseSection0.text3:
Pick two of the following courses
Complete at least 2 of the following: 
EGS4624 - Engineering Innovation and Leadership (3)
MAN3025 - Management of Organizations (3)
MAR3391 - Professional Selling (3)
PHI3638 - Ethical Issues in the 21st Century (3)
ENT 4183 - Technological Entrepreneurship Credit Hours: 3
Or
EGN 4641C - Engineering Entrepreneurship Credit Hours: 3

li.Students must have a minimum grade of \": Students must have a minimum grade of "C" (2.0) in each course or Satisfactory (in eligible courses) required for the certificate.
li.This certificate must be earned in conju: This certificate must be earned in conjunction with a degree in engineering, Information Technology, or Computer Science.
li.Not open to students seeking the Enginee: Not open to students seeking the Engineering Leadership Minor.
li.Any course substitution must be approved: Any course substitution must be approved by the Associate Dean responsible for Undergraduate Curriculum within CECS.

courseSection0.text:
Restricted Electives
None
Foreign Language Requirements
None

courseSection2.text:
Other Requirements
Students must have a minimum grade of "C" (2.0) in each course or Satisfactory (in eligible courses) required for the certificate.
This certificate must be earned in conjunction with a degree in engineering, Information Technology, or Computer Science.
Not open to students seeking the Engineering Leadership Minor.
Any course substitution must be approved by the Associate Dean responsible for Undergraduate Curriculum within CECS.
